New Records: Zimbabwe secured their first win in AFCON and World Cup qualifiers since their FIFA ban was lifted
Key Match Events: Khama Billiat converted a penalty in the first half to help Zimbabwe beat Namibia 1-0
Daniel Msendami's shot in the second half hit the upright
Douglas Mapfumo's effort was pushed out for a corner by the Namibian shot stopper
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Nees celebrated his first win as Zimbabwe's senior national team coach
Zimbabwe struggled to maintain ball possession, a consistent rhythm and lacked creativeness in the final third
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors' win is a crucial step towards securing a spot in the AFCON tournament
Zimbabwe now top Group J with five points and are one point ahead of Kenya and Cameroon
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at an empty Orlando Stadium in Soweto, Johannesburg, South Africa
Zimbabwe will play Namibia again on Monday in the second leg of the AFCON qualifier
Others: Khama Billiat was the match winner after converting a penalty in the first half
The penalty kick was awarded after Udinese's defender Jordan Zemura was fouled inside the box
